00001 /**
00002  * \file NormalDistribution.hpp

00005  * Compute normal deviates.

00008  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00009  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00010  **********************************************************************/
00011 
00012 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_NORMALDISTRIBUTION_HPP)
00013 #define RANDOMLIB_NORMALDISTRIBUTION_HPP \
00014   "$Id: 115ade76f91ab1b73b5ede74ac502d568ce3f1a0 $"
00015 
00016 #include <cmath>                // for std::log
00017 
00018 namespace RandomLib {
00019   /**
00020    * \brief Normal deviates
00021    *
00022    * Sample from the normal distribution.
00023    *
00024    * This uses the ratio method; see Knuth, TAOCP, Vol 2, Sec. 3.4.1.C,
00025    * Algorithm R.  Unlike the Box-Muller method which generates two normal
00026    * deviates at a time, this method generates just one.  This means that this
00027    * class has no state that needs to be saved when checkpointing a
00028    * calculation.  Original citation is\n A. J. Kinderman, J. F. Monahan,\n
00029    * Computer Generation of Random Variables Using the Ratio of Uniform
00030    * Deviates,\n ACM TOMS 3, 257-260 (1977).
00031    *
00032    * Improved "quadratic" bounds are given by\n J. L. Leva,\n A Fast Normal
00033    * Random Number Generator,\n ACM TOMS 18, 449-453 and 454-455 (1992).
00034    *
00035    * The log is evaluated 1.369 times per normal deviate with no bounds, 0.232
00036    * times with Knuth's bounds, and 0.012 times with the quadratic bounds.
00037    * Time is approx 0.3 us per deviate (1GHz machine, optimized, RealType =
00038    * float).
00039    *
00040    * Example
00041    * \code
00042    *   #include <RandomLib/NormalDistribution.hpp>
00043    *
00044    *   RandomLib::Random r;
00045    *   std::cout << "Seed set to " << r.SeedString() << "\n";
00046    *   RandomLib::NormalDistribution<double> normdist;
00047    *   std::cout << "Select from normal distribution:";
00048    *   for (size_t i = 0; i < 10; ++i)
00049    *       std::cout << " " << normdist(r);
00050    *   std::cout << "\n";
00051    * \endcode
00052    *
00053    * @tparam RealType the real type of the results (default double).
00054    **********************************************************************/
00055   template<typename RealType = double> class NormalDistribution {
00056   public:
00057     /**
00058      * The type returned by NormalDistribution::operator()(Random&)
00059      **********************************************************************/
00060     typedef RealType result_type;
00061     /**
00062      * Return a sample of type RealType from the normal distribution with mean
00063      * \e mu and standard deviation <i>sigma</i>.
00064      *
00065      * For \e mu = 0 and \e sigma = 1 (the defaults), the distribution is
00066      * symmetric about zero and is nonzero.  The maximum result is less than 2
00067      * sqrt(log(2) \e p) where \e p is the precision of real type RealType.
00068      * The minimum positive value is approximately 1/2<sup><i>p</i>+1</sup>.
00069      * Here \e p is the precision of real type RealType.
00070      *
00071      * @tparam Random the type of RandomCanonical generator.
00072      * @param[in,out] r the RandomCanonical generator.
00073      * @param[in] mu the mean value of the normal distribution (default 0).
00074      * @param[in] sigma the standard deviation of the normal distribution
00075      *   (default 1).
00076      * @return the random sample.
00077      **********************************************************************/
00078     template<class Random>
00079     RealType operator()(Random& r, RealType mu = RealType(0),
00080                         RealType sigma = RealType(1)) const throw();
00081   };
00082 
00083   template<typename RealType> template<class Random> inline RealType
00084   NormalDistribution<RealType>::operator()(Random& r, RealType mu,
00085                                            RealType sigma) const throw() {
00086     // N.B. These constants can be regarded as "exact", so that the same number
00087     // of significant figures are used in all versions.  (They serve to
00088     // "bracket" the real boundary specified by the log expression.)
00089     const RealType
00090       m =  RealType( 1.7156  ), // sqrt(8/e) (rounded up)
00091       s  = RealType( 0.449871), // Constants from Leva
00092       t  = RealType(-0.386595),
00093       a  = RealType( 0.19600 ),
00094       b  = RealType( 0.25472 ),
00095       r1 = RealType( 0.27597 ),
00096       r2 = RealType( 0.27846 );
00097     RealType u, v, Q;
00098     do {                        // This loop is executed 1.369 times on average
00099       // Pick point P = (u, v)
00100       u =  r.template FixedU<RealType>();    // Sample u in (0,1]
00101       v = m * r.template FixedS<RealType>(); // Sample v in (-m/2, m/2); avoid 0
00102       // Compute quadratic form Q
00103       const RealType x = u - s;
00104       const RealType y = (v < 0 ? -v : v) - t; // Sun has no long double abs!
00105       Q = x*x + y * (a*y - b*x);
00106     } while ( Q >= r1 &&        // accept P if Q < r1
00107               ( Q > r2 ||       // reject P if Q > r2
00108                 v*v > - 4 * u*u * std::log(u) ) ); // accept P if v^2 <= ...
00109     return mu + sigma * (v / u); // return the slope of P (note u != 0)
00110   }
00111 } // namespace RandomLib
00112 
00113 #endif // RANDOMLIB_NORMALDISTRIBUTION_HPP
